cause.description:
Turner Syndrome is a genetic disorder occurring exclusively in females. It results from the absence of one of the X chromosomes, in whole or in part. Even with an estimated 70,000 women and girls living with the condition in the United States alone, Turner Syndrome is relatively obscure to the general public.
The syndrome itself carries numerous health consequences, including short stature and abnormal reproductive development. While many women are successfully leading full lives with Turner Syndrome, others have been less fortunate.
It is important that we raise awareness, promote research and create support for anyone touched by Turner Syndrome.
This cause's logo is the property of the Turner Syndrome Society of the United States.
1. Fund medical research to decrease the incidence of the syndrome and support those living with it.
2. Promote awareness by leading public health campaigns.
3. Provide support to those living with or to those families affected by Turner Syndrome.
cause.mission: The Turner Syndrome Society of the United States creates awareness, promotes research, and provides support for all persons touched by Turner Syndrome.
cause.name: Turner Syndrome Awareness & Research
